text: welcome to head rush this time we're
going to turn trash into treasure
starting with this empty Styrofoam
container we're gonna turn it into a
boat and not a sailboat or a raft
we're gonna actually have a power
propulsion system with no moving parts
here are all the ingredients 9 volt
battery 2 quarters a couple of short
cables with alligator clips and a small
but powerful neodymium magnet it may
seem simple but it all adds up to a
propulsion system that might be the
future of space travel so how exactly
does it work ok it's not breaking any
water speed records here but something
is propelling this thing but what
exactly is doing the work here is it the
9-volt battery the neodymium magnet or
the salt water
the answer is salt water when a
conductive fluid is exposed to a
magnetic field and an electric current
at right angles to each other the fluid
is always propelled in a direction
perpendicular to their axes spacecraft
propulsion could work the same way
except instead of salt water you'd pull
plasma a cloud of ions that would also
act as a conductive fluid that's because
it is rocket science neat huh
